name: Strawberry-Frosted Doughnut
description: This was way too sweet, and had an incredibly artificial-tasting strawberry flavor, making it the Doughnut the loser of the classic Doughnuts. Though.

name: Cinnamon-Sugar Doughnut
description: While a great idea in theory, the ratio of cinnamon to sugar was way off here. This baby was overpowered by pure cinnamon, and NOT in a good way.

name: Jelly Doughnut
description: One taster remarked that the jelly in this confection tasted like a pudding cup. With glops of fake-tasting jelly spilling.

name: Marble-Frosted Doughnut
description: A little chocolate, a little vanilla—a whole lotta sweet.

name: Apple-Crumb Doughnut
description: Dunkin definitely nailed the apple flavor in this, though its more gas station apple pie than homemade.

name: Blueberry Doughnut
description: While one of our tasters proclaimed this to be her absolute favorite.

name: Chocolate Kreme-Filled Doughnut
description: Chocolate frosting from a can, which we don't necessarily think is totally a bad thing

name: Bavarian Kreme-Filled Doughnut
description: We had low expectations for this one, but surprisingly it was inoffensive—not great, not terrible, mediocre to its cream-filled core.

name: Vanilla-Frosted Doughnut
description: This colorful Doughnut is nothing spectacular, but definitely gets the job done.

name: Cheap-Cheerful Doughnut
description: There was one vocal hater of this Doughnut, but most of us thought this was the best of the filled-Doughnut category. It definitely gives you the chocolate-custardy flavor of the classic Beantown dessert.
